Lead architectural functions and drive development of store specific budget and fee proposals
Lead architectural activities and participate in overall project closeout
Mentor and partner with team members within Store Planning and Construction throughout the documentation process
Manage and ensurethe Landlord’s Architectand design team execute accurate construction drawings per Burlington prototype and specific lease agreements
Manage the production and delivery of full sets of CDs (construction drawings & specifications) from external partners

Organize and lead meetings involving internal & external clients/partners related to architectural development

Review contractor questions and submittals to ensure compliance with design intent and design solutions

Reviews change order requests in coordination with construction management staff.

POPULOUS has an immediate opening for designers and architects with strong conceptual design, communications and managerial skills. Applicants must have 3 years of minimum office experience. Successful candidates will be assisting in all phases of the programming, design and construction administration. Our Boston practice focuses on transit-oriented building types (primarily aviation), but also other private and civic-oriented projects.

Fluency in SketchUp and Rhinoceros for conceptual work and rendering experience in 3DSMax AND V-Ray (or Brazil r/s or Maxwell or Podium or Artlantis)

Located at the crossroads of the Green, Red and Blue MBTA subway lines, we are a quick walk from North and South Station (Commuter Rail and Amtrak). Experience developing internal sustainability training programs or teaching

LEED AP or other sustainability accreditations
Experience with sustainability on university campuses
Lived experience / background that offers a diverse perspective on sustainability in planning and urban design

The Vertex Companies, LLC (VERTEX) is a leading multidisciplinary engineering and consulting firm that provides forensic consulting, engineering design, construction management, claims & dispute resolution, environmental, and digital solutions to insurance carriers, sureties, law firms, real estate owners, property managers, public agencies, and commercial clients.

Forensic Architects are involved in a wide variety of tasks, including investigations of buildings, code research, construction document review, failure analysis, the scope of repair preparation, and report writing. Conduct forensic field inspections into the cause and origin of incidents related to residential and commercial property damage claims and/or construction or design defect claims
Research compliance with building codes and review construction and project plan documents

Develop detailed plans for remediation of loss: scope, schedule, budget

Strong knowledge of the residential (IRC), commercial (IBC), and existing (IEBC) I-codes
Travel to client sites is required for this role

This position offers an exciting opportunity to lead both ground-up buildings and technical fit-up projects from start to finish with one of the region’s most well respected and financially stable real estate firms.

Responsibilities:

Cummings Properties science and technology incubators and built-to-suit facilities are a well-know destination for lab and R&D clients. Work directly with clients and our internal leasing, construction, and engineering team, to design, build, and renovate wet labs, clean rooms, and manufacturing centers. Take responsibility for fit-up planning, specifications, construction documents, and construction administration. Outline and coordinate related HVAC, electrical, and plumbing systems. Ability to work independently and in a collaborative team environment.
High attention to detail and an ability to generate cost-effective design solutions.
Positive, “can-do” attitude, and strong written and graphic communication skills.

Job Description:
Process Architect R.A. – Life Sciences (Design Group)
Job Summary
Exciting opportunity to add to a growing firm and help lead the growth of a Process Architecture department! Provides technical leadership as functional expert in the development and design for life science (Biotech, Pharmaceutical & Medical Device) client projects from inception through development of project scope to deliver drawings and specifications packages suitable for construction, aligned with industry standards. The direction and oversite of multidisciplinary engineering disciplines leading concurrent EPCMV projects through traditional engineering phasing to support existing and new life science clients.
Responsibilities
The Lead Process Architect analyzes and develops highly specialized technical solutions associated with leading edge technology, including ISO Cleanrooms, Cell & Gene Therapy manufacturing, laboratory functions, and drug substance (API) production within existing operating cGMP facilities.
The candidate shall possess the skills and experience required to successfully define, develop, and execute project deliverables, as a client facing leader to develop and maintain client relationships, and possess prior experience interfacing with clients to establish long-term relationships.
Support life science engineering projects and active construction projects during permitting, bidding, contract award, procurement, implementation, financial administration, and sequencing during project execution, with proficiency using a BIM process that leverages Autodesk Revit, Recap and Navisworks software.
Executing integrated (EPCMV) projects to successfully define and deliver scope within budget and schedule while developing client relationships and supporting proposal generation
The Process Architect maintains current knowledge of life science industry standards, innovates best practices, incorporates regulatory requirements, and creates a shared strategy for project scope contributing to proposal development and commercial execution.
The Process Architect will perform project tasks independently and may direct the efforts of designers, including developing and mentoring of technical professionals.
Demonstrate value in the Life Science business by generating billable fees commensurate with experience level, commercial terms, and value creation, aligned with company expectations, industry standards, and career progression.
As a technical leader within the firm you are expected to assist in developing new engagements.
The primary area of support will be the Northeast Region with a client base in the Boston market, but you may support projects regionally or nationally based on your expertise and business need.
Interactions across the firm and with other professionals to maintain a cohesive and technically correct solution. This includes interfacing and resolving highly complex technical solutions with our firm-wide facility, utility, process, automation, validation, and construction professionals.
Candidates must meet several of these requirements
5+ years of facilities architectural design experience with a proven ability to lead the facility design from the programming/concept phase through the production of construction documents, permit acquisition, and site implementation on multi-discipline projects in an A&E environment.
Experience and capacity to design cGMP manufacturing and lab facilities, demonstrating knowledge of operating facility requirements to define general arrangements, operational flows, adjacency schemes, environmental classifications, and interpretation and justification of regulatory requirements.
Working knowledge of local, state, and federal building codes, and in particular IBC.
Knowledge/experience in design of both new Greenfield facilities as well as renovations to existing buildings.
Knowledge/experience in design of ISO clean rooms, labs, and processing spaces.
Knowledge/experience in design of cold storage and refrigerated processing environments.
Experience in coordinating design with process engineers on industrial installations of production equipment is a plus.
Excellent communication skills, interpersonal skills, and ability to interact with our valued team members and clients is a must.
Excellent computer skills including AutoCAD, Revit, Microsoft Office, and Microsoft Project is a plus.
Willing and able to travel as necessary for project requirements to include but not be limited to: project installation and start-up activities, client meetings, company sponsored meetings, trainings, industry related seminars, forums, or conventions, etc.
Education
Bachelor of Architecture degree is required.
Master of Architecture degree is desired
Licenses
Registered Architect license required
NCARB desired

Project Operations Supervisor (Staff Architect)

Job Description:

Position Summary:

Under the supervision of the department director or manager, the Project Operations Supervisor will coordinate facility project operations processes, code compliance outcomes, design standards and plans of record for the Planning, Design and Construction (PD&C) department. This includes, but is not limited to, project feasibility studies, project scheduling, management of physical and electronic plans, process and workflow development and continuous improvement. They will work closely with contracted design professionals including architects, engineers and contractors as well as authorities having jurisdiction to ensure code compliance.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities including but not limited to:

1. Works closely with multiple stakeholders including clinical staff, peers and administration to develop planning concepts and solutions through programming. The Project Operations Supervisor will support projects ranging from master plans, practice expansions, moves, restructuring, tenant improvement projects, renovations and new build outs.

2. Responsible for managing all organizational plans in a manner that can easily be accessed by the PD&C and Engineering & Maintenance teams. These drawings are used for accreditation processes, permitting and managing the physical plant resources among other critical needs. Therefore, a high degree of accuracy is required. The Project Operations Supervisor will manage the hospital’s master drawings by updating drawings as projects are completed as well as producing life safety drawings at least annually.

3. Encouraged to engage in state and national professional associations to identify learning opportunities in the industry and keep abreast of healthcare trends and best practices.

4. With guidance from the Project Manager, will develop design concepts, department process and workflow improvements. This will include but is not limited to:

Perform project and space surveys to evaluate planning needs with specific detail to codes, guidelines, NFPA, and ADA requirements.
Create schematic drawings for project presentations and assist in stakeholder presentations.
Review project drawings, specifications, submittals, and shop drawings for accuracy and compliance with hospital standards.
Provides feedback to RFIs, sketches, and addendums.
Perform periodic site visits to ensure quality and compliance.
Manager of the Facility Standards.
Continuously improve departmental processes and practices

5. Works closely with stakeholders including clinical staff, peers, department leaders and administration to develop conceptual plans and solutions through programming. Leads programming sessions for projects ranging from master plans, practice expansions, moves, restructurings, tenant improvement projects, renovations and ground up facilities. Provides clear direction, feedback, and support to stakeholders and designers. Measured by management observation, peer and end user feedback, and random review of documentation and project outcomes.

6. Manages all organizational drawings. Manages all facility plans and life safety drawings in a manner that can easily be accessed by the PD&C and Engineering & Maintenance teams. Actively participates in project closeout meetings. Effectively manages as built and record drawings with a high degree of accuracy. Communicates clearly where drawings can be found and how they are to be used. Accurately maintains the hospital’s master drawings by updating drawings as projects are completed. Produces updated life safety drawings at least annually. Measured by management observation, peer and end user feedback, and random review of documentation.

7. Develops design concepts and leads the process with the Projects Team on design projects. Reviews project drawings, specifications, submittals, and shop drawings for accuracy and compliance with hospital standards. Provides feedback to RFIs, sketches, and addendums. Performs periodic site visits to ensure quality and compliance. Facilitates project reviews with authorities having jurisdiction and ensures code compliance. Measured by management observation, peer and end user feedback, and random review of documentation and project outcomes.

7. Incorporates Lahey Health Mission Statement and Goals into daily activities.

8. Complies with all Lahey Health Policies.

9. Complies with behavioral expectations of the department and Lahey Health.

10. Maintains courteous and effective interactions with colleagues and patients.

11. Demonstrates an understanding of the job description, performance expectations, and competency assessment.

12. Demonstrates a commitment toward meeting and exceeding the needs of our customers and consistently adheres to Customer Service standards.

13. Participates in departmental and/or interdepartmental quality improvement activities.

14. Participates in and successfully completes Mandatory Education.

15. Performs all other duties as needed or directed to meet the needs of the department.

Minimum Qualifications:

Education:

Bachelor's degree in Architecture, Architectural Engineering Technology, computer aided design -architectural or engineering concentration required.

Licensure, Certification, Registration:
